Header.Identifier: TfL | Step-Free Tube Guide with all Toilets-ELRAD
Header.DisplayTitle: TfL | Step-Free Tube Guide with all Toilets-ELRAD
Header.Author: webteam@tfl.gov.uk
Header.FeedInfo: First version of ELRAD feed for developers

Attribution.TermsAndConditions: This feed is subject to TfL terms and conditions

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to and from as you cannot change step-free between platforms within the station. Use the Churchﬁeld Road entrance via the ticket hall for platform 2. Use the entrance on the other side of the level crossing for platform 1

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: No entrance/exit. You can change between District line westbound towards Earl’s Court and Hammersmith & City line westbound towards Hammersmith). You can change from Hammersmith & City line eastbound towards Barking onto District line eastbound towards Upminster
You can only enter and exit the southbound platform for trains towards Liverpool Street

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to and from as you cannot change step-free between platforms within the station. Use the Ridsdale Road entrance for platform 1. Use the Anerley Station Road entrance for platform 2

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: DLR only Lift from street to ticket hall only available on request – you need to press button to alert staff
You can only enter and exit the eastbound platform for trains towards Woodford
If you require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage

You can only enter and exit the northbound platform step-free for trains towards Camden Town. If you are travelling southbound on the Northern line to Borough (towards Morden) stay on the train to Clapham North, get off the southbound train and take a northbound Northern line train to Borough

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doos in between (on the car 4/5 join)

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit platform 2 towards Crystal Palace and West Croydon
If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage.

Line.DirectionTowards: New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: 200m between Jubilee line and DLR station via the street. If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage
If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage
You can only enter and exit the westbound platform for trains towards Westminster

Line.DirectionTowards: Crystal Palace and Clapham Junction via Canada Water
Richmond and Clapham Junction via Willesden Junction

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You need to use correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling from/to, as you cannot change between all platforms within station – you need to make a 360m journey via street to change between northbound platform 1 and southbound platform 2. Use Bedford Avenue entrance to get to/from southbound platform 2 – this route goes via ticket hall. Use Station Approach entrance to get to/from northbound platform 1 – this route does not go via ticket hall and is for ticket holders only.

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5
8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5
8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5
8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5

Line.DirectionTowards: New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon
New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon
New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the eastbound platform for trains towards Epping

PublicToilet.Location: In Earl's Court Road station ticket hall

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 2

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: The Circle line no longer runs in a continuous loop and you may have to change trains at Edgware Road to carry on with your journey.
You can only enter and exit the Northern line southbound platform for trains towards Morden

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You need to use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling from/to, as you cannot change between platforms within station – you need to make a 450m journey via street to change between platforms 1 and 2. Use Station Road entrance to get to/from platform 2 – this route goes via ticket hall. When travelling to Epping, ask station staff at your starting station if your train can be routed to arrive at platform 2 – this is often, but not always, possible. If you arrive at platform 1, use the Hillcrest Way entrance. This is unlocked from 1700-2000. If the gate is locked, please use Help point to ask staff to open it

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: London Overground only

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 5
2 centre doors on car 2
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join).
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join).

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the westbound Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan lines platform

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5
2 centre doors on car 5
2 centre doors on car 2
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: Both platforms are accessible only to/from the main (Devonshire Road) northbound entrance

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You need to make a 220m journey to change between the Jubilee and the Piccadilly line, a 160m journey to change between the Victoria and the Piccadilly line and a 380m journey to change between the Victoria and the Jubilee line

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from and you cannot change step-free between platforms. To access platform 1 use the Hepscott Road entrance. To access platform 2 use the Wallis Road entrance.

Line.DirectionTowards: New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: No entrance/exit to District and Piccadilly lines from 12 May until late December 2013 due to planned lift work. You need to make a 520m journey via street including lifts to change between the Hammersmith & City or Circle lines and the District or Piccadilly lines

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to and from as you cannot change step-free between platforms within the station. Both entrances are on Green Lanes

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can change between fast, semi-fast and 'all stations' trains running in the same direction.
You can only enter and exit platform 2 towards Watford Junction
You can only enter and exit platform 2 towards Watford Junction using the side entrance on Headstone Lane
If you are travelling towards Central London, you need to board the ﬁfth carriage, furthest from the lifts

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 5
2 centre doors on car 2

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: Open Mondays to Saturdays until 2345 and Sundays until 2315 only. If you are travelling to Central London you need to board the ﬁfth carriage towards the back of the train

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 5

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: If you are travelling towards Central London, you need to board the ﬁfth carriage

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 5
2 centre doors on car 2

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: London Overground only

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: Entrance/exit via stairlift for manual wheelchair users only. The maximum operating weight of the stairlift is 225kg

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 5
2 centre doors on car 2

Line.DirectionTowards: New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit platform 1 towards Richmond and Clapham Junction

Served by District line services on weekends, public holidays and during some Olympia events.You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from. Use the Olympia Way entrance for District line platform 1 towards High Street Kensington and London Overground platform 2 towards Stratford. Use the Russell Road entrance for London Overground platform 3 towards Clapham Junction

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You need the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from, as you cannot change between platforms within the station – you need to make a 600m journey via street to change between the platforms 1 and 2. Use Station Approach entrance for platform 1 towards Earl’s Court and Stratford – this route also goes via the ticket hall. Use the North Road entrance for platform 2 towards Richmond. This entrance does not go via the ticket hall and is for ticket holders only

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on cars 5 and 6
2 centre doors on cars 2 and 3

PublicToilet.Location: In King's Cross National Rail station

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can change between westbound National Rail services and eastbound DLR towards Westferry
You can only enter and exit the eastbound Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan lines platform.

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You need to make a 410m journey via street and lifts to change lines. If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors car 5
2 centre doors car 2
2 centre doors car 5 and 6
2 centre doors car 2 and 3
2 centre doors car 5

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: London Overground only
If you require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage

Use the interchange at this station to change between trains on the Uxbridge branch and trains towards Pinner. At peak times another change may be needed at Harrow-on-the-hill for trains toward Amersham/Chesham.
London Overground northbound only

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 2 centre doors on car 2
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: Step-free northbound only

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5.
8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5.

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the southbound platform towards Liverpool Street

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You need to use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling from/to, as you cannot change between platforms within station - you need to make a 520m journey via street to change between platforms 1 & 2. Use Station Way entrance to get to/from eastbound platform (platform 2) - this route goes via ticket ofﬁce. Use Station Approach & Cherry Tree Rise entrance to get to/from westbound platform (platform 1) - this route does not go via ticket ofﬁce, so is for ticket holders only

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the eastbound platform for Metropolitan line eastbound towards Liverpool Street and Piccadilly line eastbound towards Oakwood
DLR only

Line.DirectionTowards: New Cross, Clapham Junction, Crystal Palace and West Croydon

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/ exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from. To access platform 1 use the Kingswood Terrace entrance. To access platform 2 use the Palmerston Road entrance

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: If you require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage
You can only enter and exit the eastbound platform towards Epping – this is via George Lane (West) entrance, closed on Sundays

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You can only enter/exit the station using the station car park entrance – to get from car park to ticket hall you need to make a journey of 110m including steep ramps. No entrance/ exit using London Road/bus station entrance – you need to make a 450m journey via street between entrances

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)
Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join)

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You need to make a journey of up to 100m including lifts and ramps to change between some lines. If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage

You need the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travellling to/from, as you cannot change between all platforms within the station – you need to make a 150m journey via street to change between the eastbound and westbound platforms. Use Station Approach entrance to get to/from eastbound platform – this route goes via ticket ofﬁce. Use Orchard Gate entrance to get to/ from westbound platform – this route does not go via ticket hall, so is for ticket holders only

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from. Use the Peak Hill Gardens entrance for platform 1. Use the Station Approach entrance for platform 2

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the eastbound platform for trains towards Epping

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: Both sets of double doors on cars 4 and 5, plus the 2 single doors in between (on the car 4/5 join).

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: This station is served by Piccadilly line trains until 0650 Monday to Saturday, 0745 Sunday and after 2230 every evening. Interchange between District and Piccadilly lines is therefore only possible at these times.

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You must use the correct entrance/ exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from. Entrances to both platforms are on Holloway Road

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter and exit the Jubilee line, both directions. If you are boarding the Jubilee line at this station and require level access to leave the train at Green Park, please make sure that you travel in the correct carriage

PublicToilet.Location: In waiting area on platform 6, accessible toilet in ticket hal.

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: If you are travelling to Wembley Park from stations east of Westminster and require level access, please ensure that you board the correct carriage. If you are travelling to Wembley Park from Green Park and require level access, please continue to Kingsbury and ask a member of staff for assistance

Line.LocationOfLevelAccess: 8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5
8 Car trains, Cars 4 and 5. 3rd door Car 4, 1st door Car 5

Accessibility.AdditionalAccessibilityInformation: You can only enter/exit District line platform 2 towards Earl’s Court and London Overground platforms 3 and 4

SpecificEntrance.SpecificEntranceInstructions: You need to use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from, as you cannot change between all platforms within the station – you need to make a 350m journey via street to change between the northbound and southbound platforms. Use Nether Street entrance to get to/from northbound platform – this route goes via ticket ofﬁce. Use Wentworth Street entrance to get to/from southbound platform – this route does not go via ticket ofﬁce and is for ticket holders only; it is only unlocked during AM peak hours, and locked with a RADAR lock at other times, so call 0845 330 9880 or use Help Point on the southbound platform to ask staff to unlock the gate at other times if you do not have a RADAR key

You need to use the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from, as you cannot change between all platforms within the station – you need to make a 130m journey via street to change between the eastbound and westbound platforms. Use Snakes Lane East/Madeira Grove entrance to get to/from westbound platform – this route goes via ticket ofﬁce; it is only unlocked until 2100, so use intercom to ask staff to unlock gate at other times. Use The Broadway entrance to get to/from eastbound platform – this route goes via separate ticket ofﬁce

You need the correct entrance/exit depending on which platform you are travelling to/from, as you cannot change between both platforms within the station – you need to make a 600m journey via street to change between the northbound and southbound platforms. Use Woodside Park entrance to get to/from southbound platform – this route goes via ticket ofﬁce. Use Holden Road car park entrance to get to/from northbound platform – this route does not go via ticket ofﬁce and is for ticket holders only
